speaker: Narrator
text: This is unit two of Pimsleur's French one. Listen to this conversation.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Pardon, Monsieur. Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Oui. Est-ce que vous comprenez l'anglais, Mademoiselle?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Non, Monsieur, je ne comprends pas l'anglais.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Pardon, Monsieur. Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Oui. Est-ce que vous comprenez l'anglais, Mademoiselle?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Non, Monsieur, je ne comprends pas l'anglais.

speaker: Narrator
text: The word "le" is very lightly pronounced. Listen again.

speaker: Narrator
text: Is just sort of tacked on to the previous word. Now practice pronouncing it after the French speaker.

speaker: Narrator
text: Tell me that you understand French.

speaker: Narrator
text: Now tell me that you understand French a little.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Ask me if I understand French.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Narrator
text: Once again, notice how slight the "L" sound is, but it is there. Listen and repeat.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Narrator
text: Here, notice how the "N" sound on-

speaker: Narrator
text: ... is also very slight. Listen and repeat.

speaker: Narrator
text: And now say, "I don't understand French."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Did you observe the "N" sound in-

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: And how would you say, "I understand a little."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: ... sound like the speaker's? Repeat after him, part by part.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Do you remember how to ask, "Are you American?"

speaker: Narrator
text: How would she say to him, "Yes, you're American"?

speaker: Narrator
text: Ask the woman, "Do you understand English?"

speaker: Narrator
text: Here's how the French say, "Hello, good morning," or, "Hi."

speaker: Narrator
text: This literally means "good day." First, the word, "good." Listen and repeat.

speaker: Narrator
text: If the woman were married, here's how you would address her. Listen and repeat.

speaker: Narrator
text: Now you want to ask, "How are you?" First, let's practice the word, "how."

speaker: Narrator
text: For, "How are you?" The French say, "How do you go?" So here is how to say, "You go." Listen and repeat.

speaker: Narrator
text: In order to make this into a question, we could use the "est-ce que" form. But in this case, another way is more common. Instead of saying "vous allez", just turn it around and say "allez-vous?"  This makes it a question.

speaker: Narrator
text: Now listen and repeat as the speaker asks, "how are you?"

speaker: Narrator
text: Did you notice the "T" sound at the end of "comment?" Listen again.

speaker: Narrator
text: This shows that the word "comment" is spelled with a "T" at the end. But this is a disappearing sound. It is pronounced only when the next word begins with a vowel, as "allez" does here.

speaker: Narrator
text: How would you say "good morning, miss"?

speaker: Narrator
text: Ask the man how he is.

speaker: Narrator
text: Here's how to say "goodbye" in French. Listen and repeat.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Do you remember how to say, "Excuse me, ma'am?"

speaker: Narrator
text: How would she ask you if you understand English?

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Narrator
text: Tell her you understand French a little.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Here's how you might say, "Not very well." Listen and repeat.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: How does she say that she understands English a little?

speaker: Narrator
text: Try to say "I don't understand very well."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas très bien.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne comprends pas très bien.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Let's try a conversation in French. Let's assume that the person you're speaking to is a young woman, not married. Answer her when she talks to you.

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: Try this conversation one more time.

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous comprenez le français?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je comprends un peu le français.

speaker: Narrator
text: This is the end of unit two.
